title: Ticket #1701: Soap code calls realpath() incorrectly
description:
Function serve_file() in src/condor_daemon_core.V6/soap_core.cpp calls libc function realpath() incorrectly on non-linux unix machines. It relies on a glibc extension that will malloc space for the function's answer if NULL is passed as the second argument. On AIX and Solaris, this causes the call to fail. On Mac OS X 10.4 and 10.5, this causes the program to crash. Mac OS X 10.6 adds the extended behavior.

serve_file() should be changed to pass in a buffer of size PATH_MAX.
